1. indacenodithiophene (IDT)
2. naphtho [1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) (NT)

| Stille copolymerization |

In the given paragraph, the only "Material Name" entity is:

The other entities in the original paragraph do not refer to the value of a material property. "Three" refers to the number of polymers, "Stille copolymerization" is a chemical reaction, "indacenodithiophene (IDT)" and "naphtho [1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) (NT)" are chemical compounds, and "monomers" are molecules that can be bonded together to form a larger molecule. None of these refer to a material property value. However, "enlarged coplanar skeleton" could potentially refer to a structural property of the synthesized polymers.
